alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Macon; Montgomery (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 27 at 6:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Bullock, Macon and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 621 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Montgomery, Milstead, Pike Road, Coosada, Shorter, Mount Meigs, Waugh, Auburn University In Montgomery, Eastdale Mall, Tysonville, Lagoon Park, Pinedale, Gunter Air Force Base, Victoryland, Alabama State University, Montgomery Zoo, Boylston, Alabama State Capitol, Montgomery Riverwalk Stadium and Bob Woodruff Lake.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
